benefits.title: Clinical use of Hypericum perforatum (St John's wort) in depression: A meta-analysis.
benefits.summary: St. John's wort has comparable efficacy and safety when compared to SSRIs for patients with mild-to-moderate depression.

benefits.title: Complementary and alternative medicine in the treatment of bipolar disorder--a review of the evidence.
benefits.summary: St. John's wort has the potential to treat mild to moderate depression, but may also induce mania.

benefits.title: Economic evaluation of St. John's wort (Hypericum perforatum) for the treatment of mild to moderate depression.
benefits.summary: St. John's wort is a cost-effective alternative to antidepressants, with reduced incidence of adverse effects and improved outcomes in mild to moderate depression.

benefits.title: Phytochemical characterization of various St. John's Wort extracts.
benefits.summary: St. John's Wort is used for its beneficial effects on the nervous system, especially as an antidepressant.

benefits.title: St. John's Wort: more implications for cancer patients.
benefits.summary: St. John's wort has been used for treating depression, excitability, neuralgia, fibrositis, sciatica, and anxiety, but may interact with many important drugs, potentially mitigating their effects.
benefits.journal: Journal of the National Cancer Institute

benefits.title: Effect of St.John's wort (Hypericum perforatum) oily extract for the care and treatment of pressure sores; a case report.
benefits.summary: St. John's wort oily extract provides significant efficacy for the treatment of pressure sore wounds in ICU patients.

benefits.title: Activation of CREB by St. John’s wort may diminish deletorious effects of aging on spatial memory
benefits.summary: St. John's wort effectively prevents aging-induced deterioration of spatial memory in 18 month-old rats, possibly by activating CREB regulated genes associated with memory formation.

benefits.title: St John’s Wort
benefits.summary: St. John's wort extracts are effective in treating depression, even in severe cases, and have better tolerability than tricyclic antidepressants.

benefits.title: Drug interactions with St. John's wort products.
benefits.summary: St. John's wort can cause breakthrough bleeding in women taking oral contraceptive pills, but when used at a low dose (0.65 mg of hyperforin), such an interaction is not expected.

benefits.title: Complementary and alternative medicine for the treatment of major depressive disorder.
benefits.summary: St John's wort and regular exercise appear effective in the treatment of depression, with St John's wort being equivalent to antidepressant drugs with fewer side effects.
benefits.journal: Canadian family physician Medecin de famille canadien

side effects.title: Effects of St. John's wort on irinotecan metabolism.
side effects.summary: St. John's wort can reduce plasma levels of irinotecan, potentially impacting treatment outcome.
side effects.journal: Journal of the National Cancer Institute

side effects.title: Mania associated with St. John’s wort
side effects.summary: St. John's wort may precipitate hypomania, mania, or increased cycling of mood states, particularly in patients with occult bipolar disorder.

side effects.title: The Effects of St. John's Wort Extract and Amitriptyline on Autonomic Responses of Blood Vessels and Sweat Glands in Healthy Volunteers
side effects.summary: St. John's wort extract had no effect on blood vessels and sweat glands, while amitriptyline diminished skin conductance and prolonged the dilation phase of cutaneous blood flow.

side effects.title: In Vitro Activity of St. John's Wort Against Cytochrome P450 Isozymes and P-Glycoprotein
side effects.summary: St. John's wort can affect the disposition of concurrently used conventional drugs, potentially leading to adverse side effects.

side effects.title: Delayed‐type hypersensitivity reaction to St. John's wort extract confirmed by patch testing
side effects.summary: St. John's wort extract can induce the liver enzyme CYP3A4, but true allergic or hypersensitivity reactions are rare.

side effects.title: St. John's Wort reduces neuropathic pain through a hypericin-mediated inhibition of the protein kinase Cgamma and epsilon activity.
side effects.summary: St. John's Wort reduces neuropathic pain in rats without showing behavioral side effects or altered locomotor activity.

side effects.title: Psychotic Episode During Use of St. John's Wort
side effects.summary: St. John's wort use is associated with delirium with psychotic features in some cases, potentially affecting older adults with underlying dementia.

side effects.title: Masked Clinical Pictures (Macroscopic Haematuria and Toxic Hepatitis)Resulting from Saint John's Wort Poisoning: Two Case Reports
side effects.summary: Side effects of St. John's Wort consumption include nausea, diarrhea, insomnia, anxiety, fatigue, dry mouth, dizziness, headache, allergic skin reactions, and paresthesia.

side effects.title: Photodynamic Sensory Neuropathy in a Patient Treated With St John's Wort.
side effects.summary: St John's wort can cause photosensitivity, leading to allodynia in the hands after sun exposure.
side effects.journal: The primary care companion for CNS disorders

side effects.title: St. John's wort: a new alternative for depression?
side effects.summary: St. John's wort has proven to be free of any cardiac, as well as anticholinergic, side-effects normally seen with antidepressant medications.
side effects.journal: International journal of clinical pharmacology and therapeutics

dosage.title: A pilot randomised, open, uncontrolled, clinical study of two dosages of St John's wort (Hypericum perforatum) herb extract (LI-160) as an aid to motivational/behavioural support in smoking cessation.
dosage.summary: St. John's wort herb extract (LI-160) was taken 300 mg once or twice daily for one week before and 3 months after a target quit date.

dosage.title: Comparing phytopharmaceuticals: The example of St. John’s Wort
dosage.summary: 900 mg of St. John's Wort extract is the standard dosage, but smaller amounts, particularly ethanolic extracts, are indicated to achieve the desired effect.

dosage.title: St. John's Wort for depressive disorders: results of an outpatient study with the Hypericum preparation HYP 811.
dosage.summary: HYP 811, a high-dose formulation of St. John's Wort extract, was effective in treating depression and improving well-being.

dosage.title: Effect of St John's Wort on Drug Metabolism by Induction of Cytochrome P450 3A4 Enzyme
dosage.summary: One 300-mg St. John's wort tablet 3 times per day was administered in the study.

dosage.title: Consumer Use of St. John's Wort: A Survey on Effectiveness, Safety, and Tolerability
dosage.summary: Mean dosage of St. John's wort was 475.6 ± 360 mg/day (range 300–1200 mg/day).
dosage.journal: Pharmacotherapy: The Journal of Human Pharmacology and Drug Therapy

dosage.title: Complementary, holistic, and integrative medicine: St. John's wort.
dosage.summary: The starting dose of St. John's wort in children aged 6 and 16 years for treatment of major depressive disorder was 150 mg 3 times daily for 4 weeks.

dosage.title: [St. John's wort: interaction with cyclosporine increases risk of rejection for the kidney transplant and raises daily cost of medication].
dosage.summary: St. John's wort was taken at a dose of 300 mg three times daily in the study.

dosage.title: Drug Interactions with St John’s Wort
dosage.summary: St John's wort may reduce the efficacy of co-medications, and its use should be restricted to prescription-only by experienced clinicians.
